Subject: biomass gasification: Help with reaction kinetics and modeling
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=316009323; y=C4gfPweVoitYHtjd6Eqjr0KxeTHFaIbBpSJxSEHK9XM8DPF1e72QlkKd
X-Yahoo-Profile: lorenzo_damiani
X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 10 Jul 2007 11:31:50 -0000

Hello,

I am a PhD Student, and I am working on biomass gasification 
model=
ing. A colleague told me about Cantera, and described it as a 
powerful dev=
ice for reactors modeling: I downloaded it immediately!

As I am intended t=
o implement a kinetic model for biomass 
gasification, I would like to unde=
rstand what is the best way to do 
it, and which functions may I re-utilize=
 among the many in the 
Cantera toolbox. 

The problem is: I would like to =
construct a 1 dimensional model able 
to reproduce the temperature, velocit=
y and composition profiles along 
the axis of the reactor as the gas flows =
through the active surface 
of charcoal. Should I use a single reactor cont=
aining ODE solution 
along the axial co-ordinate or should I link many 0-D =
reactors 
together?
What about chemical reactions modeling? Mainly, the mod=
el should work 
with the following reactions:

C+2H2<=3D>CH4 ; C+CO2<=3D>2C=
O; C+H2O<=3D>CO+H2; CH4+H2O<=3D>CO+3H2

Is there in the Cantera tools a kin=
etic model for these reactions?

Moreover, is there something that I can us=
e to implement a model of 
biomass pyrolysis?

Thank you for your help!

Lo=
renzo
